column5: Took this video with a GoPro a few weeks ago.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e4NmfTxSecI  Jon
cool video. I love salamanders I used to catch em and keep em as pets. I loved all the different colours I could find them in. good bait for sure.
You found the mother load! I used to find them in the bellies of brookies and splake that I caught in Algonquin Park. I don't think that you can legally use them as bait though.
Very cool.........love me some salamander huntin. The kids always get a kick out of them  Too cute to use as bait,......i could never

Wow, we used to catch some on rocky shorelines of Oxtongue Lake when I was a kid, never seen anything like that however. I am sure that like all amphibians they are under stress, hope no one is using them as bait, legally or otherwise.
Seems like no shortage there.Thanks for sharing!

My sons and I witnessed the same thing in my Dads pond a few weeks ago. They were the salamanders with the blue dots on them. I caught a couple so the kids could have a closer look. The branches nearby had thousands of eggs on them. Cute critters for sure. Great video
Just want to make clear that I have never used them as bait, just simply stating that they would be good bait as I'm sure fish don't mind eating them.
i dont think its illegal to use salamanders for bait in canada
i dont think its illegal to use salamanders for bait in canada  It is illegal to use them as bait in Ontario.  I am not sure about the rest of Canada.
